en: IT WAS A BRIGHT cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen. Winston Smith, his chin nuzzled into his breast in an effort to escape the vile wind, slipped quickly through the glass doors of Victory Mansions, though not quickly enough to prevent a swirl of gritty dust from entering along with him.

en: The hallway smelt of boiled cabbage and old rag mats. At one end of it a colored poster, too large for indoor display, had been tacked to the wall. It depicted simply an enormous face, more than a meter wide: the face of a man of about forty-five, with a heavy black mustache and ruggedly handsome features. Winston made for the stairs. It was no use trying the lift. Even at the best of times it was seldom working, and at present the electric current was cut off during daylight hours. It was part of the economy drive in preparation for Hate Week. The flat was seven flights up, and Winston, who was thirty-nine and had a varicose ulcer above his right ankle, went slowly, resting several times on the way. On each landing, opposite the lift shaft, the poster with the enormous face gazed from the wall. It was one of those pictures which are so contrived that the eyes follow you about when you move. Big Brother Is Watching You, the caption beneath it ran.

E ne e bontÅ¡a feela sefahleho se seholo, bophara ba limithara tse fetang mithara: sefahleho sa monna ea ka bang mashome a mane a metso e mehlano, se nang le mustache e boima e ntÅ¡o le likarolo tse matsutla-tsutla tse ntle. Winston o ile a etsa litepisi E ne e sa sebelisoe ho leka ho phahamisa. Esita le ka linako tse ling e ne e sa fumanehe hangata, 'me hajoale motlakase o ile oa khaoloa nakong ea lihora tsa motÅ¡ehare. E ne e le karolo ea moruo oa ho khanna ho itokisetsa beke ea lehloeo. E ne e le lifofane tse supileng ho nyoloha, 'me Winston, ea neng a le mashome a mararo a metso e robong' me o ne a na le seso sa varicose ka holim'a maqaqailana a hae a letona, a tsamaea butle, a phomola ka makhetlo a 'maloa tseleng. Ka lehlakoreng le leng le le leng la ho fihla, ho na le lehare le nang le sefahleho se sengata se shebileng lebota. tn: Bathroom Tile Bathroom Floor Tile Backs & Old Rag Mats. Kwa bofelong, go ne go na le mebala e e kwa godimo thata, e e neng e le ka fa gare ga yone e ne e le ka fa gare, e ne ya leboga lebota. E ne e bontsha sefatlhego se segolo fela, bophara jwa dimetara tse di fetang 15: sefatlhego sa monna yo o ka nnang 45, se se nang le sentsho se se bokete le diponagalo tse di ntle. Winston A Go Go For The Stairs E ne e se ka ya dirisiwa go leka go fofa. Le fa go ntse jalo, ka dinako tse dingwe go ne go se na sepe se se sa tlwaelegang, mme jaanong motlakase o ne wa kgaolwa mo diureng tsa motshegare. E ne e le bontlha bongwe jwa beke e e neng e le gone go ipaakanyetsa letsatsi la go ikhula. E ne e le difofane di le supa, mme Winston, yo o neng a le 39 mme a na le seso sa varicose fa godimo ga leratla la gagwe le le jang, a tsamaya ka bonya, a ikhutsa ka makgetlo a le mmalwa mo tseleng. Fa go ntse jalo, go ya kwa godimo, go ya kwa godimo, go na le difatlhogo tse di kwa godimo tse di tswang kwa godimo go tswa mo loboteng. E ne e le nngwe ya ditshwantshÃ´ tse di go tshwenyang thata mo e leng gore matlho a gago a go latela fa o fuduga. Mma Ausi O Go Shebile , Mzansi

mg: Ny lalantsaran'ny laisoa mangotraka sy ny tsihy efa antitra. Tamin'ny lafiny iray tamin'izany dia nisy afisy miloko, lehibe loatra ho an'ny fampisehoana ao an-trano, izay napetaka teo amin'ny rindrina. Mampiseho endrika goavana fotsiny izany, mihoatra ny iray metatra ny sakany: ny tarehin'ny lehilahy iray eo amin'ny dimy amby efapolo eo, miaraka amin'ny volombava mainty mavesatra sy ny endrika tsara tarehy. Winston dia nanao ny tohatra. Tsy misy dikany ny manandrana ny fanaisorana. Na dia tamin'ny fotoana tsara indrindra aza dia zara raha niasa izany, ary amin'izao fotoana izao dia tapaka ny herinaratra mandritra ny ora mazava. Tafiditra tao anatin'ny hetsika ara-toekarena ho fanomanana ny Herinandron'ny Fankahalana izany. Sidina fito no tao amin'ilay trano, ary i Winston, izay sivy amby telopolo taona ary voan'ny aretin'ny varicose teo ambonin'ny kitrokeliny havanana, dia nandeha miadana, naka aina imbetsaka teny an-dalana. Isaky ny mipetraka, mifanohitra amin'ny shaft, dia mijery avy eny amin'ny rindrina ilay afisy misy ny tarehy goavana. Iray amin'ireo sary ireo izay tena voaforona izany ka manaraka anao ny maso rehefa mihetsika ianao. Mijery anao ny Big Brother, nihazakazaka ny maribolana teo ambaniny.

en: AS HE PUT HIS HAND to the doorknob Winston saw that he had left the diary open on the table. DOWN WITH BIG BROTHER was written all over it, in letters almost big enough to be legible across the room. It was an inconceivably stupid thing to have done. But, he realized, even in his panic he had not wanted to smudge the creamy paper by shutting the book while the ink was wet.

st: Mohala o ne o fana ka tsebe e arolang tsebe e ileng ea tsoela pele ka tlhokomeliso e le 'ngoe ka metsotsoana e mashome a mararo. E ne e le matsatsi a supileng le leshome le metso e mehlano, e leng nako ea ho fumana mosebetsi oa basebetsi. 'Mele oa hae o ile a tsoa betheng,' me setho sa Mokha oa Kantle se ile sa fumana li-coupons tse likete tse tharo selemo le selemo, 'me sutu ea pajamas e ne e le li-pajamas tse makholo a tÅ¡eletseng mme a nka sekhetho se le seng le sekho se le seng le sekho se le seng se le sekhuts'oane se neng se le leshano ka mose setulo. Li-ersers li tla qala ka metsotso e meraro. Motsotsong o latelang o ne a imenne habeli ke ho khohlela ho mabifi ho loketseng hoo e ka bang kamehla a mo hlaselang kapele ka mor'a ho tsoha. E ile ea tÅ¡olla matÅ¡oafo a hae ka ho feletseng hoo a ka qalang ho phefumoloha hape ka ho rapalla mokokotlong oa hae le ho nka letoto la likhase tse tebileng. Ho ne ho e-na le hoo, ho ne ho e-na le li-mushroom tse neng li e-na le li-varicose, 'me li-varicose li ile tsa qala ho hlohlona.

tn: Mogala o ne wa ntsha tsebe e e kgaoganyang tsebe, e e neng ya tswelela mo metsotsong e le 30. Go ne go na le dingwaga di le 75, mme go ne go na le nako ya go dira tiro e e neng e le teng. A re o ne a le mo dikobong tse pedi tse di neng di le mo go lone, a re o ne a na le dikuku di le 3 000 fela ka ngwaga, mme go ne go na le dikuku di le 600 tse di neng di le mo go lone. Go tlaa simololwa mo metsotsong e le meraro. Mo nakong e e tlang, o ne a itlhatlhoba ka gore o ne a na le bolwetse jo bo masisi jo bo neng bo mo tlhasela ka bonako fa a sena go tsoga. O ne a simololwa gotlhelele ka gore o ne a kgona go hema gape ka go rapama kwa morago le go tsaya motseletsele wa disedi tse di tseneletseng. Go ne go na le ditshika tsa gagwe tse di neng di le mo tseleng e e neng e le teng, mme ditshika tsa gagwe di ne tsa simolola go ruruga.

en: The pain of the coughing fit had not quite driven out of Winstonâ€™s mind the impression made by his dream, and the rhythmic movements of the exercise restored it somewhat. As he mechanically shot his arms back and forth, wearing on his face the look of grim enjoyment which was considered proper during the Physical Jerks, he was struggling to think his way backward into the dim period of his early childhood. It was extraordinarily difficult. Beyond the late Fifties everything faded. When there were no external records that you could refer to, even the outline of your own life lost its sharpness. You remembered huge events which had quite probably not happened, you remembered the detail of incidents without being able to recapture their atmosphere, and there were long blank periods to which you could assign nothing. Everything had been different then. Even the names of countries, and their shapes on the map, had been different. Airstrip One, for instance, had not been so called in those days: it had been called England or Britain, though London, he felt fairly certain, had always been called London.

st: Bohloko ba ho khohlela bo ne bo sa khannoa haholo kelellong ea Winston maikutlo a entsoeng ke toro ea hae, mme metsamao ea rhythmic ea boikoetliso e ile ea e khutlisa. Ha a ntse a thunya matsoho a hae morao le koana, a apere sefahleho sa hae ponahalo ea monate o monate o neng o nkuoa o le motle nakong ea Jerks ea 'Mele, o ne a loanela ho nahana ka tsela ea hae morao nakong e lefifi ea bongoaneng ba hae ba pele. Ho ne ho le thata ka tsela e makatsang. Ka nÄ£'ane ho li-1000, tsohle li ile tsa fela. Ha ho ne ho se na litlaleho tsa kantle tseo u ka li buang, esita le tlhaloso ea bophelo ba hau e lahlehetsoe ke bohale ba eona. U hopola liketsahalo tse kholo tseo mohlomong li neng li sa etsahale, u hopola lintlha tsa liketsahalo ntle le ho khona ho ts'oara moea oa tsona hape, 'me ho bile le linako tse telele tse se nang letho tseo u ka li abelang letho. Ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe e ne e fapane ka nako eo. Esita le mabitso a linaha, le libopeho tsa bona 'mapeng, li ne li fapane. Airstrip One, ka mohlala, o ne a e-s'o bitsoa mehleng eo: e ne e bitsoa England kapa Brithani, Leha ho le joalo London, o ne a ikutloa a le bonnete ba hore kamehla o ne a bitsoa London.

tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go se na sepe se a neng a se dira fa a ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo go yone e neng e le mo go yone e ne ya nna le ditoro tse di neng di le mo tseleng e a neng a di dira ka yone. Fa a ntse a le kwa morago, a apara sefatlhego sa gagwe se se monate se se neng se tsewa e le se se siameng ka nako ya fa a ne a le mokima, o ne a leka go akanya ka tsela e e sa bolong go ya go fitlha kwa tshimologong ya gagwe. Go ne go le thata go dira jalo. Gone Gone Beyond The Late 50s All Gone Fa o ne o se na tshedimosetso e e ka tswang kwa ntle e o ka e dirisang, tota le tsela e o tshelang ka yone e ka latlhegelwa ke botshelo jwa gago. O ne wa gopola dilo tse dintsi tse o neng o sa di dira, o ne wa gopola gore o ne o ka se kgone go di dira sentle, mme go ne go na le nako e telele e o neng o ka e dirisa. Ka nako eo, dilo tsotlhe di ne di sa tshwane. Tota le maina a dinaga, le dibopego tsa tsone mo mmapeng, di ne di sa tshwane. Ka sekai, go ne go ise go ye kae, go ne go ise go ye kae fa e ne e bidiwa Engelane kgotsa Kwa Engelane, le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a itse gore o kile a bidiwa London.

mg: Tsy dia nanosika loatra an'i Winston hiala tao an-tsain'i Winston ny fahatsapana nataon'ny nofinofiny, ary ny hetsika ara-kiran'ilay fanazaran-tena dia namerina izany tamin'ny laoniny. Rehefa nitifitra ny sandriny tamin'ny fomba mekanika izy, nitafy teo amin'ny tavany ny endriky ny fahafinaretana mampalahelo izay noheverina ho mety nandritra ny Jerks Physical, dia sahirana izy nieritreritra ny lalany mihemotra ao anatin'ny vanim-potoana ratsy tamin'ny fahazazany. Tena sarotra tokoa izany. Taorian'ny faran'ny taona 50, nanjavona ny zava-drehetra. Rehefa tsy nisy rakitsoratra avy any ivelany izay azonao jerena, na dia ny drafitry ny fiainanao manokana aza dia very ny fahasiahany. Tsaroanao ireo zava-nitranga goavana izay mety tsy nitranga mihitsy, tsaroanao ny antsipirihan'ny zava-nitranga nefa tsy afaka naka indray ny rivotra iainana, ary nisy fotoana lava tsy nisy na inona na inona azonao nomena na inona na inona. Hafa ny zava-drehetra tamin'izany fotoana izany. Na dia ny anaran'ny firenena aza, sy ny endriny eo amin'ny sarintany, dia samy hafa. Tsy dia nantsoina loatra ny Airstrip One tamin'izany andro izany: nantsoina hoe Angletera na Angletera izany, na dia nahatsiaro ho azo antoka aza i Londona, fa nantsoina foana hoe Londona.

en: Winston could not definitely remember a time when his country had not been at war, but it was evident that there had been a fairly long interval of peace during his childhood, because one of his early memories was of an air raid which appeared to take everyone by surprise. Perhaps it was the time when the atomic bomb had fallen on Colchester. He did not remember the raid itself, but he did remember his fatherâ€™s hand clutching his own as they hurried down, down, down into some place deep in the earth, round and round a spiral staircase which rang under his feet and which finally so wearied his legs that he began whimpering and they had to stop and rest. His mother, in her slow dreamy way, was following a long way behind them. She was carrying his baby sisterâ€”or perhaps it was only a bundle of blankets that she was carrying: he was not certain whether his sister had been born then. Finally they had emerged into a noisy, crowded place which he had realized to be a Tube station.

tn: Winston o ne a sa kgone go gopola nako e naga ya gagwe e neng e ise e nne kwa ntweng, mme go ne go bonala gore go kile ga nna le nako e e siameng ya kagiso mo dingwageng tsa gagwe tsa bosha, ka ntlha ya gore sengwe sa gagwe sa bogologolo se ne se na le tlhaselo ya moya e e neng e bonala e tsaya mongwe le mongwe ka go gakgamala. Gongwe e ne e le nako ya fa bomo ya atomo e ne e wetse kwa Colchester. O ne a sa gakologelwe gore o ne a sa tlhole a le mo tseleng, mme a gakologelwa gore o ne a itlhaganetse ka fa tlase ga gagwe fa a ne a itlhaganetse, a fologela mo lefelong lengwe le le boteng mo lefatsheng, a dikologa le tsela e e tsamayang ka fa tlase ga dinao tsa gagwe, mme kwa bofelong o ne a simolola go tshikinya maoto a gagwe, mme ba ne ba tshwanelwa ke go emisa le go ikhutsa. Mmaagwe o ne a le mo tseleng e e bonya, o ne a mo latela ka lobaka lo loleele. O ne a le mo rwesa diaparo tse a neng a di apere, gongwe e ne e le sepoko fela se a neng a se na le sone, mme o ne a sa itse gore o ne a sa itse gore a o tshotswe ka nako eo. Kwa bofelong, ba ne ba tsena mo lefelong le le neng le tletse thata le a neng a itse gore ke lefelo le a neng a le mo go lone.

mg: Tsy tsaroan'i Winston mihitsy ny fotoana iray izay tsy nisian'ny ady tao amin'ny fireneny, saingy hita mazava fa nisy fotoana somary naharitra ela tamin'ny fandriampahalemana nandritra ny fahazazany, satria ny iray tamin'ireo fahatsiarovany voalohany dia ny fanafihana an'habakabaka izay toa nahazendana ny rehetra. Angamba tamin'izay fotoana izay no nianjeran'ny baomba atomika tao Colchester. Tsy tsaroany ilay fanafihana, saingy tsaroany ny tanan'ny rainy nifampitohy tamin'ny tanany rehefa nidina haingana izy ireo, nidina, nidina tany amin'ny toerana lalina iray lalina tao amin'ny tany, boribory sy manodidina ny tohatra miolikolika izay nanakoako teo ambanin'ny tongony ary farany dia reraka be ny tongony ka nanomboka nikiakiaka izy ary tsy maintsy nijanona sy niala sasatra izy ireo. Ny reniny, tamin'ny fomba miadana nofinofy, dia nanaraka lavitra ny lalana aorian'izy ireo. Nitondra ny zandriny vavy izyâ€”na angamba bodofotsy fotsiny no nentiny: tsy azony antoka raha teraka tamin'izany ny anabaviny. Farany, nipoitra tao amin'ny toerana feno tabataba sy feno olona izy ireo izay tsapany fa gara Tube.

en: He remembered how once he had been walking down a crowded street when a tremendous shout of hundreds of voicesâ€”womenâ€™s voicesâ€”had burst from a side street a little way ahead. It was a great formidable cry of anger and despair, a deep, loud â€œOh-o-o-o-oh!â€ that went humming on like the reverberation of a bell. His heart had leapt. Itâ€™s started! he had thought. A riot! The proles are breaking loose at last! When he had reached the spot it was to see a mob of two or three hundred women crowding round the stalls of a street market, with faces as tragic as though they had been the doomed passengers on a sinking ship. But at this moment the general despair broke down into a multitude of individual quarrels. It appeared that one of the stalls had been selling tin saucepans. They were wretched, flimsy things, but cooking pots of any kind were always difficult to get. Now the supply had unexpectedly given out. The successful women, bumped and jostled by the rest, were trying to make off with their saucepans while dozens of others clamored round the stall, accusing the stallkeeper of favoritism and of having more saucepans somewhere in reserve. There was a fresh outburst of yells. Two bloated women, one of them with her hair coming down, had got hold of the same saucepan and were trying to tear it out of one anotherâ€™s hands. For a moment they were both tugging, and then the handle came off. Winston watched them disgustedly. And yet, just for a moment, what almost frightening power had sounded in that cry from only a few hundred throats! Why was it that they could never shout like that about anything that mattered?

st: O ile a hopola kamoo a kileng a theohela seterateng se tletseng batho ba makholo ha mantsoe a mangata a basali a ile a phatloha seterateng hanyane. E ne e le sello se tÅ¡abehang sa bohale le ho nyahama, se tebileng, se phahameng "Oh-o-oh-oh!" e ileng ea humming joalo ka ho reverberation ea bell. Pelo ea hae e ne e le s'a e-na le eona. E qalile! O ne a nahana. Ho ho ho, a riot! Qetellong, li-bolts lia robeha! Ha a fihla sebakeng seo e ne e le ho bona mokoloko oa basali ba makholo a mabeli kapa a mararo, ba pota-potileng likhahla tsa 'maraka oa seterateng, ba nang le lifahleho tse bohloko joalokaha eka e ne e le bapalami ba doomed ka sekepeng se sinking. Empa ka nako ena, ho nyahama ka kakaretso ho ile ha qhoma ka bongata ba batho ka bomong. Ho ile ha bonahala eka e 'ngoe ea li-stalls li ne li rekisa li-saucepans tsa thini. Li ne li le bohloko, tse monate, empa ho pheha lipitsa tsa mofuta ofe kapa ofe ho ne ho le thata ho li fumana. Hona joale ho ne ho se na mokhoa o sa lebelloang. Basali ba atlehileng, ba bumped le jostled ke ba bang kaofela, ba ne ba leka ho li-sauces ha ba bang ba bangata ba clamored ho potoloha stall, ba qosa mohlokomeli oa stall ea favoritism le ho ba le li-saucepan tse ling tse ngata sebakeng se boloketsoeng. Ho ne ho e-na le ho phatloha ha li-mushroom tse ncha. Basadi ba babedi ba nang le bloated, e mong wa bona a theoha, a tshwara sopho e le nngwe, mme a leka ho e qhaqha matsohong a e mong. Ka nako e 'ngoe, ba ne ba ntse ba koala ka bobeli, 'me ka mor'a moo, ba ile ba khaola. Winston o ile a ba bona ba hloname haholo. Mme leha ho le joalo, ka motsotsoana, matla a batlang a tÅ¡osang a ne a utloahala ka mohoo oo ho tsoa metsong e makholo a 'maloa feela! Ke hobane'ng ha ba ne ba sa khone ho hoeletsa ka ntho leha e le efe e amanang le eona?

tn: O ne a gakologelwa gore o ne a ntse a tsamaya mo tseleng e e neng e tletse thata fa go ne go na le modumo o mogolo wa mantswe a a ntsintsi a a rileng a a neng a le mo go one, a tswa mo tseleng e e kwa tlase. E ne e le selelo se segolo sa tÅ¡hakgalo le go kgobega marapo, se se neng se le kwa godimo se se neng se le mo go sone, se se neng sa dira gore motho a se ka a swa. Pelo ya gagwe e ne e opa. Go Simogo! O ne a akanya jalo. Go Riot go! Kgabagare go ne go na le mongwe yo o neng a tshela! Fa a sena go fitlha kwa lefelong leo, go ne go na le basadi ba le makgolo a mabedi kgotsa a le mararo ba ba neng ba le mo letlhakoreng la motse, ba ne ba na le difatlhego tse di botlhoko jaaka e kete e ne e le bapalami ba ba neng ba le mo sekepeng se se neng se mo sinking. Le fa go ntse jalo, ka nako eo, go ne ga nna le dikgaragano tse dintsi tsa batho. A re go ne go na le sengwe sa dilo tse di neng di rekisiwa ka disukujane. Go ne go le thata go dira dilo tse di sa tlwaelegang, mme ka dinako dingwe go ne go le thata go di dira. Jaanong go ne go na le tlamelo e e neng e sa lebelelwa. Basadi ba ba atlegileng, ba ne ba huduga le ba ba setseng, ba ne ba leka go huduga ka ditshipi tsa bone, fa ba bangwe ba le bantsi ba ne ba tlhotlhorega, ba latofatsa molebedi wa maemo a a kwa godimo le go nna le letswai le le oketsegileng mo mafelong a a kwa tlase. 'Go ne go na le melodi e e sa tswang go Ã´na' - There was a fresh of screams Basadi ba babedi ba ba rurufetseng, e mong wa bona a theoha, a tshwara lesoko le le leng, mme a leka ho e tlosa matsohong a bona. Ka nako e le nngwe ba ne ba huduga, mme morago ga moo ba ne ba tswa. Winston A Go Go Watch It's A Shame Mme gone, ka nakwana fela, go ne ga utlwala gore maatla a a neng a tshosa a ne a utlwala mo selelong seo go tswa mo metsaneng e le makgolo a le mmalwa fela! Ke ka ntlha yang fa ba ne ba sa kgone go bua dilo tse di ntseng jalo?

mg: Tsaroany fa indray mandeha izy no nandeha tamin'ny arabe feno olona rehefa injay nisy feo an-jatony nirehidrehitra â€” feon'ny vehivavyâ€”nipoaka avy teny amin'ny sisin-dalana iray lavidavitra kokoa. Hiakam-pahatezerana sy fahadisoam-panantenana lehibe izany, "Oh-o-o-oh!" izay lasa nidobodoboka toy ny feon'ny lakolosy. Nidobodoboka ny fony. Manomboka izany! Nieritreritra izy. Korontana! Vaky ihany ny proles amin'ny farany! Rehefa tonga teo amin'ilay toerana izy dia nahita andian'olona roa na telonjato nitangorona nanodidina ny talantalan'ny tsena an-dalambe iray, miaraka amin'ny endrika mampalahelo toy ny hoe izy ireo no mpandeha voaozona tao anaty sambo rendrika. Saingy tamin'izay fotoana izay dia nivadika ho fifandirana maro teo amin'ny tsirairay ny fahadisoam-panantenana ankapobeny. Hita fa nivarotra saosy vita amin'ny siny ny iray tamin'ireo talantalana. Nikorontan-tsaina izy ireo, zavatra tsy dia misy dikany, saingy sarotra foana ny mahazo vilany fahandroan-tsakafo isan-karazany. Tsy nampoizina intsony ny famatsiana. Niezaka ny hiala tamin'ny saosiny ireo vehivavy nahomby, izay nidona tamin'ny ambiny sy nofantsihan'ny ambiny, raha toa ka am-polony hafa kosa no nihodinkodina teo amin'ny talantalana, niampanga ilay mpiandry trano ho manana fiangarana sy manana saosy maro kokoa any amin'ny toerana iray. Nisy ny fipoahana vao haingana. Vehivavy roa mibontsina, ny iray tamin'izy ireo niaraka tamin'ny volony nidina, dia nahazo saosy iray ihany ary niezaka ny nandrovitra izany teo am-pelatanan'ny andaniny sy ny ankilany. Nandritra ny fotoana fohy dia samy nitabataba izy roa lahy, ary avy eo dia niala ny tanana. Nijery azy ireo tamim-paharikorikona i Winston. Kanefa, fotoana fohy monja, toy ny ahoana re no nandrenesan'ny hery nampatahotra tao anatin'izany hiaka avy amin'ny tenda an-jatony vitsivitsy monja izany! Nahoana no tsy afaka nihiaka toy izany mihitsy izy ireo mikasika ny zavatra manan-danja?

en: The point was that at both trials all three men had confessed that on that date they had been on Eurasian soil. They had flown from a secret airfield in Canada to a rendezvous somewhere in Siberia, and had conferred with members of the Eurasian General Staff, to whom they had betrayed important military secrets. The date had stuck in Winstonâ€™s memory because it chanced to be Midsummer Day; but the whole story must be on record in countless other places as well. There was only one possible conclusion: the confessions were lies.

en: â€œSteamerâ€ was a nickname which, for some reason, the proles applied to rocket bombs. Winston promptly flung himself on his face. The proles were nearly always right when they gave you a warning of this kind. They seemed to possess some kind of instinct which told them several seconds in advance when a rocket was coming, although the rockets supposedly traveled faster than sound. Winston clasped his forearms about his head. There was a roar that seemed to make the pavement heave; a shower of light objects pattered onto his back. When he stood up he found that he was covered with fragments of glass from the nearest window.

en: But if there was hope, it lay in the proles. You had to cling onto that. When you put it in words it sounded reasonable; it was when you looked at the human beings passing you on the pavement that it became an act of faith. The street into which he had turned ran downhill. He had a feeling that he had been in this neighborhood before, and that there was a main thoroughfare not far away. From somewhere ahead there came a din of shouting voices. The street took a sharp turn and then ended in a flight of steps which led down into a sunken alley where a few stallkeepers were selling tired-looking vegetables. At this moment Winston remembered where he was. The alley led out into the main street, and down the next turning, not five minutes away, was the junk shop where he had bought the blank book which was now his diary. And in a small stationerâ€™s shop not far away he had bought his penholder and his bottle of ink.

st: Empa haeba ho ne ho e-na le tÅ¡epo, e beha ka har'a li-proles. U tlameha ho khomarela sena. Ha u e beha ka mantsoe, e utloahala e utloahala; 'Me ha u ne u sheba batho ba fetang o ka pavement hore e ile ea e-ba ketso ea tumelo. Seterata seo a ileng a se etsa hore a se ke a theohela tlase. O ne a nahana hore o ne a e-na le maikutlo a hore o ne a le sebakeng sena sa marang-rang pele, le hore ho ne ho se na sebaka se seholo se seholo se neng se le hole. Ho tloha ka nako e 'ngoe ho ne ho e-na le lentsoe la ho hoeletsa. Seterata se ile sa fetoha se bohale ebe se fela ka sefofane sa mehato se ileng sa theohela ka alley ea letsatsi moo balebeli ba stall ba 'maloa ba neng ba rekisa meroho e shebahalang e khathetse. Ka nako eo, Winston o ile a hopola moo a neng a le teng. The alley e ile ea etella pele seterateng se seholo, 'me ho theosa le phetoho e latelang, eseng metsotso e mehlano, e ne e le lebenkele la junk moo a neng a rekile buka e se nang letho e neng e le buka eo hona joale e neng e le buka ea hae ea libuka. Le lebenkeleng le lenyenyane la stationer hole o ne a rekile penholder hae le botlolo ea hae ea enke.

tn: Mme fa go ne go na le tsholofelo, e ne e le mo ditshitshing. Gotta go that. Fa o bua mafoko a a utlwalang, o ne a utlwala. E rile o bona batho ba go feta fa godimo ga matlapa a a kwa godimo, gore e ne ya nna tiro ya tumelo. 'The street that he turned turned downhill' - Mmila o a neng a le mo go lone o ne a hukutha O ne a akanya gore o ne a le mo motseng ono pele, mme go ne go se na sepe se segolo se se neng se le kgakala. Go tswa kwa pele go ne go na le modumo o o utlwalang o o sesane. Go ne ga nna le tsela e e bogale mme morago ga moo go ne ga felela ka sefofane se se neng se dira gore go nne le lefelo le le neng le tsamaya mo go lone go neng go na le balebedi ba le mmalwa ba ba neng ba rekisa merogo e e neng e le mo go yone. Ka nako eo, Winston o ne a gakologelwa gore o ne a le kae. O ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo mmileng o mogolo, e seng metsotso e le metlhano, e ne e le lebenkele le a neng a le mo go lone le le neng le na le buka e e neng e le ya gagwe. Mme mo lebenkeleng le lennye le lennye le lennye le ne le sa kgone go reka pene ya gagwe le lebotlolo la yone la enke.

mg: Fa raha misy ny fanantenana, dia nitoetra tao amin'ny proles. Tsy maintsy nifikitra tamin'izany ianao. Rehefa apetrakao amin'ny teny izany dia toa mitombina izany; Tamin'ny fotoana nijerenao ireo olombelona nandalo teo amin'ny sisin-dalana no nanjary fihetsika feno finoana izany. Nihazakazaka nidina ny arabe izay nalehany. Tsapany fa efa tany amin'io faritra io izy taloha, ary nisy lalana lehibe tsy lavitra teo. Avy any amin'ny toerana iray mankany ho any dia nisy feo nihiaka mafy. Nivadika mafy ny arabe ary avy eo niafara tamin'ny fisidinana tamin'ny tohatra izay nitondra nankany amin'ny lalan-kely iray izay nahitana mpiandry trano vitsivitsy nivarotra legioma reraka. Tamin'izay fotoana izay dia nahatsiaro ny toerana nisy azy i Winston. Nivoaka ho eny amin'ny arabe lehibe ilay lalana, ary ny fihodinana manaraka, tsy dimy minitra lavitra, dia ilay toeram-pivarotana tsy misy dikany izay nividianany ilay boky tsy misy na inona na inona izay diariny ankehitriny. Ary tao amin'ny toeram-pivarotana kely iray tsy lavitra teo dia nividy ny penholder sy ny tavoahangy ranomaintyny izy.

en: â€œYou are very much older than I am,â€ said Winston. â€œYou must have been a grown man before I was born. You can remember what it was like in the old days, before the Revolution. People of my age donâ€™t really know anything about those times. We can only read about them in books, and what it says in the books may not be true. I should like your opinion on that. The history books say that life before the Revolution was completely different from what it is now. There was the most terrible oppression, injustice, povertyâ€”worse than anything we can imagine. Here in London, the great mass of the people never had enough to eat from birth to death. Half of them hadnâ€™t even boots on their feet. They worked twelve hours a day, they left school at nine, they slept ten in a room. And at the same time there were a very few people, only a few thousandsâ€”the capitalists, they were calledâ€”who were rich and powerful. They owned everything that there was to own. They lived in great gorgeous houses with thirty servants, they rode about in motor cars and four-horse carriages, they drank champagne, they wore top hatsâ€”â€

st: Winston o ile a re: "U se u le moholo ho feta kamoo ke leng kateng. U ka be u le motho ea hÅlileng pele ke hlaha. U ka hopola hore na e ne e le joang mehleng ea khale, pele ho Phetohelo. Batho ba mehleng ea ka ha ba tsebe letho ka linako tseo. Re ka bala feela ka tsona libukeng, 'me seo e se buang libukeng e kanna ea se be' nete. Nka rata maikutlo a hau ka sena. Libuka tsa nalane li re bophelo pele phetohelo e ne e fapane ka ho felletseng le seo e leng sona hona joale. Ho na le khatello e tÅ¡abehang ka ho fetesisa, ho hloka toka, bofuma,+ ho feta eng kapa eng eo re ka nahanang. Mona London, bongata bo boholo ba batho ha bo e-s'o ka ba le lijo tse lekaneng ho tloha tsoalong ho isa lefung. Halofo ea bona e ne e se na maoto a bona. Ba ile ba sebetsa lihora tse leshome le metso e 'meli ka letsatsi' me ba tloha sekolong se senyane, ba robala ka kamoreng e le 'ngoe. Ka nako e ts'oanang ho ne ho e-na le batho ba 'maloa feela,' me ho ne ho se na li-capitalists tse 'maloa feela,' me ba ne ba bitsoa eka ke mang kapa mang ea ruileng le ea matla. Ba ne ba na le tsohle tseo ba neng ba na le tsona. Ba ne ba lula matlong a matle a maholo a nang le bahlanka ba mashome a mararo, ba ne ba palama likoloi tsa makoloi le likariki tsa pere tse 'nÃ¨, ba noa champagne, ba ne ba roala likatiba tse holimo.+

tn: Winston a re: "O godile thata go feta nna. 'O tshwanetse wa bo o le motho yo o godileng pele ke tsalwa' - You should be a grown man before I was born O ka kgona go gopola gore go ne go ntse jang mo metlheng ya bogologolo, fa o ne o le mo malatsing a bofelo. Batho ba dingwaga tsa me ga ba itse sepe ka dinako tseo. Re kgona go bala ka tsone fela mo dikwalong, mme se se buiwang mo dikwalong se ka tswa se seyo. Ke rata kakanyo ya gago ka ga se. Baebele ya re botshelo bo ne bo sa tshwane gotlhelele le se e leng sone gone jaanong. Go ne go na le kgatelelo e e boitshegang, tshiamololo, botlhoki jo bo maswe go feta sengwe le sengwe se re ka akanyang ka lone. Mo Aferika Borwa, bontsi jwa batho ga ba ise ba ke ba nne le dijo tse dintsi tse di ka jewang ke loso. Sephatlo sa dinao tsa bone di ne di se na sepe. Ba ne ba bereka diura di le 12 ka letsatsi, ba tswa sekolong ka nako ya borobongwe mme ba robala ka lesome mo phaposing. Ka nako eo go ne go na le batho ba le mmalwa fela, go ne go na le batho ba le mmalwa fela ba ba neng ba bidiwa ba ba humileng le ba ba maatla. Le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a na le sengwe le sengwe se a nang le sone. Ba ne ba nna mo matlong a a gakgamatsang a ba neng ba na le batlhanka ba le 30, ba palama dikoloi tsa dikoloi le dikoloi tse di palameng dipitse di le nne, ba nwa champagne, ba ne ba apara diaparo tse di kwa godimo.

mg: "Efa antitra kokoa noho izaho ianao," hoy i Winston. "Tsy maintsy efa olon-dehibe ianao talohan'ny nahaterahako. Azonao atao ny mahatsiaro ny zavatra nitranga tamin'ny andro taloha, talohan'ny Revolisiona. Tsy mahalala na inona na inona momba ireo fotoana ireo ny olona mitovy taona amiko. Afaka mamaky momba azy ireo amin'ny boky fotsiny isika, ary mety tsy marina izay lazainy ao amin'ireo boky. Tiako ny hevitrao momba izany. Milaza ny bokin'ny tantara fa tsy mitovy tanteraka amin'ny ankehitriny ny fiainana talohan'ny Revolisiona. Nisy ny fampahoriana mahatsiravina, ny tsy rariny, ny fahantranaâ€”ratsy kokoa noho izay rehetra azontsika eritreretina. Tany Londres, dia tsy nanana sakafo ampy mihitsy ny ankamaroan'ny olona, nanomboka tamin'ny fahaterahana ka hatramin'ny fahafatesana. Ny antsasaky ny olona dia tsy nanana kiraro teo amin'ny tongony. Niasa adiny roa ambin'ny folo isan'andro izy ireo, niala an-tsekoly tamin'ny sivy taona, natory folo tao amin'ny efitrano iray. Ary tamin'izany fotoana izany dia vitsy dia vitsy ny olona, an'arivony vitsy monjaâ€”kapitalista, nantsoina izy ireoâ€”izay nanan-karena sy matanjaka. Izy ireo no tompon'ny zavatra rehetra izay nananany. Nipetraka tao amin'ny trano tsara tarehy izy ireo niaraka tamin'ny mpanompo telopolo, nandeha tamin'ny fiara sy kalesy efatra, nisotro champagne izy ireo, nanao satroka ambony izy ireoâ€”"

en: Winston sat back against the window sill. It was no use going on. He was about to buy some more beer when the old man suddenly got up and shuffled rapidly into the stinking urinal at the side of the room. The extra half-liter was already working on him. Winston sat for a minute or two gazing at his empty glass, and hardly noticed when his feet carried him out into the street again. Within twenty years at the most, he reflected, the huge and simple question, â€œWas life better before the Revolution than it is now?â€ would have ceased once and for all to be answerable. But in effect it was unanswerable even now, since the few scattered survivors from the ancient world were incapable of comparing one age with another. They remembered a million useless things, a quarrel with a workmate, a hunt for a lost bicycle pump, the expression on a long-dead sisterâ€™s face, the swirls of dust on a windy morning seventy years ago; but all the relevant facts were outside the range of their vision. They were like the ant, which can see small objects but not large ones. And when memory failed and written records were falsifiedâ€”when that happened, the claim of the Party to have improved the conditions of human life had got to be accepted, because there did not exist, and never again could exist, any standard against which it could be tested.

Winston siguiÃ³ unos minutos sentado contemplando su vaso vacÃ­o y, casi sin darse cuenta, se encontrÃ³ otra vez en la calle. Dentro de veinte aÃ±os, a lo mÃ¡s â€”pensÃ³â€”, la inmensa y sencilla pregunta Â«Â¿Era la vida antes de la RevoluciÃ³n mejor que ahora?Â» dejarÃ­a de tener sentido por completo. Pero ya ahora era imposible contestarla, puesto que los escasos supervivientes del mundo antiguo eran incapaces de comparar una Ã©poca con otra. Recordaban un millÃ³n de cosas insignificantes, una pelea con un compaÃ±ero de trabajo, la bÃºsqueda de una bomba de bicicleta que habÃ­an perdido, la expresiÃ³n habitual de una hermana fallecida hacÃ­a muchos aÃ±os, los torbellinos de polvo que se formaron en una maÃ±ana tormentosa hace setenta aÃ±os... pero todos los hechos trascendentales quedaban fuera del radio de su atenciÃ³n. Eran como las hormigas, que pueden ver los objetos pequeÃ±os, pero no los grandes. Y cuando la memoria fallaba y los testimonios escritos eran falsificados, las pretensiones del Partido de haber mejorado las condiciones de la vida humana tenÃ­an que ser aceptadas necesariamente porque no existÃ­a ni volverÃ­a nunca a existir un nivel de vida con el cual pudieran ser comparadas.

st: Winston o ile a khutlela ka fensetereng ea fensetere. E ne e sa sebelisoe ho tsoela pele. O ne a le haufi le ho reka biri e eketsehileng ha monnamoholo a tsoha ka tÅ¡ohanyetso mme a ikoahlanya ka potlako ka har'a urinal ea stinking ka lehlakoreng la kamore. The extra half-litres e ne e se e ntse e sebetsa ho eena. Winston o ile a lula motsotso kapa a mabeli a shebile khalase ea hae e se nang letho, 'me ha aa ka a hlokomela ha maoto a hae a mo isa seterateng hape. Lilemong tse mashome a mabeli ka ho fetesisa, o ile a bontÅ¡a, potso e kholo le e bonolo, "Na bophelo bo ne bo le betere pele ho Phetohelo ho feta hona joale?" e ka be e felile hanngoe le hore bohle ba arabe. Leha ho le joalo, ho ne ho ke ke ha khoneha esita le hona joale, kaha baphonyohi ba 'maloa ba hasaneng ba tsoang lefats'eng la khale ba ne ba sa khone ho bapisa lilemo tse ling le tse ling. Ba hopola lintho tse milione tse se nang thuso, ho qabana le motho ea sebetsang, ho tsoma pompo ea baesekele e lahlehileng, polelo ea sefahleho sa khaitseli ea khale e shoeleng, ho soahloa lerÅle hoseng ho mashome a supileng a fetileng; Leha ho le joalo, linnete tsohle tse nepahetseng li ne li le ka ntle ho pono ea bona. Ba ne ba tÅ¡oana le ant, e ka bonang lintho tse nyenyane empa eseng tse kholo. Mme ha memori e hloleha mme direkoto tse ngotsweng di ne di le leshano,ha seo se etsahala, tleleime ya Party ho ntlafatsa maemo a bophelo ba motho e ne e lokela ho amohelwa, hobane ha ho le teng, mme ha ho sa ka ha eba teng hape, maemo afe kapa afe a ka lekiloeng.

tn: Winston A Go Go On The Window. Go ne go sa dirisiwe sepe. O ne a le gaufi le go reka biri e e oketsegileng fa monnamogolo a nanoga ka tshoganyetso mme a ikÃ´pa ka bonako mo ntlong e e kwa thoko ga ntlo. Le fa go ntse jalo, halofo ya bone e ne e setse e mo direla. A re o ne a eme metsotsonyana kgotsa a le mabedi, a sa lemoge fa dinao tsa gagwe di mo isa kwa mmileng gape. Mo dingwageng di le 20 tse di fetileng, o ne a ipotsa jaana: "A botshelo bo ne bo le botoka go na le botshelo jo bo botoka go feta gone jaanong?" go ne go ka bo go le botoka gore batho botlhe ba arabe. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go sa kgonege gore gompieno batho ba le bantsi ba ba neng ba falola mo lefatsheng la bogologolo ba ne ba sa kgone go bapisa dingwaga tse dingwe le tse dingwe. Ba ne ba gopola dilo di le milione tse di se nang mosola, kgang e e nang le modiri, e tsoma pompo ya baesekele e e latlhegileng, polelo mo sefatlhegong sa ga kgaitsadi yo o suleng lobaka lo loleele, e bong lerole mo mosong wa phefo mo dingwageng di le 70 tse di fetileng; Le fa go ntse jalo, dilo tsotlhe tse di neng di le mo teng ga tsone di ne di le kwa ntle ga tsela e ba lebang dilo ka yone. Ba ne ba tshwana le leswana le lennye, le le ka bonang dilo tse dinnye mme e seng tse di kgolo. Fa go ne go le thata go lemoga le go kwala direkoto tse di kwadilweng di ne di sa tlhole di le teng, tleleimi ya Phathi e e tokafaditseng maemo a botshelo jwa motho e ne e tshwanetse go amogelwa, ka gonne go ne go sa tlhole go le teng, e bile go ka se tlhole go le teng, maemo mangwe le mangwe a a ka nnang a lekwa ka ona.

mg: Nipetraka teo amin'ny varavarankely i Winston. Tsy nampiasaina izany. Efa saika hividy labiera bebe kokoa izy rehefa nitsangana tampoka ilay lehilahy antitra ary niditra haingana tao amin'ny urinal manitra teo amin'ny sisin'ny efitrano. Efa niasa taminy ny antsasaky ny litatra. Nipetraka nandritra ny iray na roa minitra nijery ny verany foana i Winston, ary zara raha nahatsikaritra izany rehefa nitondra azy nivoaka teny an-dalana indray ny tongony. Tao anatin'ny roapolo taona farafahakeliny, nieritreritra izy, ny fanontaniana goavana sy tsotra hoe: "Tsara kokoa ve ny fiainana talohan'ny revolisiona noho ny amin'izao fotoana izao?" dia mety nitsahatra indray mandeha sy ho an'ny rehetra mba ho azo vahana. Saingy raha ny marina dia tsy azo novaliana izany na dia amin'izao fotoana izao aza, satria tsy afaka nampitaha ny vanim-potoana iray tamin'ny vanim-potoana iray hafa ireo sisa velona vitsivitsy avy amin'ny tontolo fahiny. en: The tiny interior of the shop was in fact uncomfortably full, but there was almost nothing in it of the slightest value. The floor-space was very restricted, because all round the walls were stacked innumerable dusty picture frames. In the window there were trays of nuts and bolts, worn-out chisels, penknives with broken blades, tarnished watches that did not even pretend to be in going order, and other miscellaneous rubbish. Only on a small table in the corner was there a litter of odds and endsâ€”lacquered snuffboxes, agate brooches, and the likeâ€”which looked as though they might include something interesting. As Winston wandered toward the table his eye was caught by a round, smooth thing that gleamed softly in the lamplight, and he picked it up.

En el escaparate se exhibÃ­an portaplumas rotos, cinceles mellados, relojes mohosos que no pretendÃ­an funcionar y otras baratijas. SÃ³lo en una mesita de un rincÃ³n habÃ­a algunas cosas de interÃ©s: cajitas de rapÃ©, broches de Ã¡gata, etc. Al acercarse Winston a esta mesa le sorprendiÃ³ un objeto redondo y brillante que cogiÃ³ para examinarlo.
es_results:
Based on the passage, I'm going to take a guess that the book is "1984" by George Orwell.

Here's my reasoning:

* The passage describes a small, cluttered shop with many worthless items, which seems to fit with the dystopian and impoverished atmosphere of "1984".
* The mention of "cuadros" (pictures) covering the walls and "portaplumas rotos" (broken pens) in the display case suggests a sense of decay and neglect, which

tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go se na sepe se se neng se le mo go yone go neng go se na sepe se se neng se le botlhokwa thata mo go sone. Mo godimo ga moo, go ne go na le mafelo a a neng a le mo go one, ka gonne go ne go na le ditshika tsotlhe tse di neng di na le ditshipi tse di neng di le teng. Mo fensetereng go ne go na le di-trays tsa di-nuts le di-bolts, tse di aparoang, di-penknives tse di nang le di-blades tse di thubegileng, tse di neng di sa itiragaletse le tse dingwe tse di neng di sa itiragaletse. Mo tafoleng e nnye fela mo sekhutlong se se neng se le teng, go ne go na le matlakala a a sa itumediseng mme a felela ka di-snuffbox, di-brooches, le tse di jaaka e kete di ka akaretsa sengwe se se kgatlhisang. E rile fa a ntse a lebile kwa tafoleng, o ne a fefolwa ke se se borethe, se se borethe se se neng se le mo leseding, mme a se tsaya.

en: Winston immediately paid over the four dollars and slid the coveted thing into his pocket. What appealed to him about it was not so much its beauty as the air it seemed to possess of belonging to an age quite different from the present one. The soft, rainwatery glass was not like any glass that he had ever seen. The thing was doubly attractive because of its apparent uselessness, though he could guess that it must once have been intended as a paperweight. It was very heavy in his pocket, but fortunately it did not make much of a bulge. It was a queer thing, even a compromising thing, for a Party member to have in his possession. Anything old, and for that matter anything beautiful, was always vaguely suspect. The old man had grown noticeably more cheerful after receiving the four dollars. Winston realized that he would have accepted three or even two.

st: Hanghang Winston o ile a lefa chelete e fetang liranta tse 'ne' me a thella ntho ea coveted ka pokothong ea hae. Seo a neng a se entse e ne e se botle ba sona joalo ka ha moea o ne o bonahala o le oa mehleng ea khale o fapane le oa hona joale. Khalase e bonolo le e nang le metsi ha e tÅ¡oane le khalase efe kapa efe eo a kileng a e bona. Ntho eo e ne e hohela habeli ka lebaka la ho se na thuso ea eona, leha ho ka etsahala hore e kile ea e-ba e reretsoe ho ba pampiri. E ne e le boima haholo ka pokothong ea hae, empa ka lehlohonolo ha ea ka ea etsa bulge e ngata. E ne e le ntho ea queer, esita le ntho e sekisetseng, hore setho sa Mokha se na le thepa ea hae. Ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe ea khale, 'me bakeng sa ntho leha e le efe e ntle, e ne e lula e belaelloa ka mokhoa o sa hlakang. Monnamoholo o ile a hola a thabile haholo kamora ho fumana lidolara tse 'ne. Winston o ile a hlokomela hore o ne a tla amohela tse tharo kapa tse peli.

tn: Ka yone nako eo, O ne a duela madi a a fetang a diranta di le nne mme a tsenya madi a gagwe mo seatleng sa gagwe. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go lebega bontle jwa gagwe bo ne bo sa tshwane le jwa dingwaga tse di farologaneng le tsa gompieno. Metsi a pula a ne a sa tshwane le a galase e a kileng a e bona. Se se ne se le botlhokwa thata ka ntlha ya gore ga go na mosola, le fa a ne a ka akanya gore e kile ya bo e le tiro ya go dira tiro. E ne e le bokete mo seatleng sa gagwe, mme ka lesego ga e a ka ya dira gore go nne le madi a mantsi. E ne e le selo se se itumedisang tota, tota le se se neng sa dira gore motho a nne le seabe mo botshelong jwa gagwe. Le fa go ntse jalo, sengwe le sengwe se se gakgamatsang se ne se sa ntse se le teng, se ne se sa ntse se bonala sentle. Monnamogolo o ne a itumela thata fa a sena go amogela diranta di le nne. O ne a lemoga gore o ka bo a amogetse di le tharo kgotsa di le pedi.

Ny zavatra rehetra taloha, ary amin'izany zavatra tsara izany, dia tsy dia nanana ahiahy mazava foana. Vao mainka faly ilay lehilahy zokiolona rehefa nahazo ny vola efatra dolara. en: He lit another lamp, and, with bowed back, led the way slowly up the steep and worn stairs and along a tiny passage, into a room which did not give on the street but looked out on a cobbled yard and a forest of chimney pots. Winston noticed that the furniture was still arranged as though the room were meant to be lived in. There was a strip of carpet on the floor, a picture or two on the walls, and a deep, slatternly armchair drawn up to the fireplace. An old-fashioned glass clock with a twelve-hour face was ticking away on the mantelpiece. Under the window, and occupying nearly a quarter of the room, was an enormous bed with the mattress still on it.

HabÃ­a una alfombra en el suelo, un cuadro o dos en las paredes, y un sillÃ³n junto a la chimenea. Un antiguo reloj de cristal, en cuya esfera figuraban las doce horas, estilo antiguo, emitÃ­a su tictac desde la repisa de la chimenea. Bajo la ventana y ocupando casi la cuarta parte de la estancia habÃ­a una enorme cama con el colchÃ³n descubierto.

Tsikaritr'i Winston fa mbola nalamina toy ny hoe natao hipetrahana ilay efitrano. Nisy karpety teo amin'ny tany, sary iray na roa teo amin'ny rindrina, ary seza lava sy mahafinaritra izay natao teo amin'ny toeram-pamoretana. Nisy famantaranandro fitaratra efa tranainy iray izay misy tarehy roa ambin'ny folo ora izay nivezivezy teo amin'ilay lambam-baravarana. en: It could not have been ten seconds, and yet it seemed a long time that their hands were clasped together. He had time to learn every detail of her hand. He explored the long fingers, the shapely nails, the work-hardened palm with its row of calluses, the smooth flesh under the wrist. Merely from feeling it he would have known it by sight. In the same instant it occurred to him that he did not know what color the girlâ€™s eyes were. They were probably brown, but people with dark hair sometimes had blue eyes. To turn his head and look at her would have been inconceivable folly. With hands locked together, invisible among the press of bodies, they stared steadily in front of them, and instead of the eyes of the girl, the eyes of the aged prisoner gazed mournfully at Winston out of nests of hair.

st: E ne e ke ke ea e-ba metsotsoana e leshome, empa ho bonahala eka ke nako e telele hore matsoho a bona a koetsoe hammoho. O ne a na le nako ea ho ithuta ka botlalo ka letsoho la hae. O ile a hlahloba menoana e melelele, manala a sebopeho, palema e thatafetseng mosebetsing ka mola oa eona oa li-calluses, nama e boreleli tlas'a letsoho. O ne a ka be a tsebile seo ka ho bona. Hang-hang ho ile ha etsahala ho eena hore o ne a sa tsebe hore na mahlo a ngoanana ke 'mala ofe. Mohlomong li ne li le sootho, empa ka linako tse ling batho ba nang le moriri o lefifi ka linako tse ling ba ne ba e-na le mahlo a maputsoa. Ho fetola hlooho ea hae le ho mo sheba e ka be e bile booatla bo ke keng ba lekanngoa. Ka matsoho a koaletsoe hammoho, a sa bonahaleng har'a khatello ea 'mele, ba ne ba shebile butle-butle ka pel'a bona, mme ho e-na le mahlo a ngoanana, mahlo a motÅ¡oaruoa ea tsofetseng a shebile ka ho lla ka Winston ka lihlaha tsa moriri.

tn: E ne e ka bo e se ka ya bo e le dingwaga di le 10, mme go ne go lebega e kete diatla tsa bone di ne di le mmogo. O ne a na le nako ya go ithuta dintlha tsotlhe tsa seatla sa gagwe. O ne a sekaseka menwana e meleele, manno a sebopego, palema e e thatafaditsweng ya tiro ka mela ya yone ya di-calluse, nama e e borethe ka fa tlase ga letsogo. O ne a ka bo a itse fela gore o ne a ka bo a itse seo ka nako ya fa a ne a bona. Ka yone nako eo, o ne a sa itse gore matlho a mosetsana o ne a na le mmala ofe. Gongwe di ne di le borokwa, mme gantsi batho ba ba nang le moriri o o lefifi ka dinako tse dingwe ba ne ba na le matlho a mahibidu. Fa a ne a le mo tlhogong, a ka bo a ne a lebega a le bosilo. Ka diatla tse di sa bonaleng mmogo, tse di sa bonaleng tsa mmele, di ne di lebile ka iketlo fa pele ga tsona, mme go na le matlho a mosetsana, matlho a mogolegwi yo o tsofetseng a leba ka khutsafalo ka Winston mo dihlahaneng tsa moriri.

en: He looked up. It was the girl. She shook her head, evidently as a warning that he must keep silent, then parted the bushes and quickly led the way along the narrow track into the wood. Obviously she had been that way before, for she dodged the boggy bits as though by habit. Winston followed, still clasping his bunch of flowers. His first feeling was relief, but as he watched the strong slender body moving in front of him, with the scarlet sash that was just tight enough to bring out the curve of her hips, the sense of his own inferiority was heavy upon him. Even now it seemed quite likely that when she turned round and looked at him she would draw back after all. The sweetness of the air and the greenness of the leaves daunted him. Already, on the walk from the station, the May sunshine had made him feel dirty and etiolated, a creature of indoors, with the sooty dust of London in the pores of his skin. It occurred to him that till now she had probably never seen him in broad daylight in the open. They came to the fallen tree that she had spoken of. The girl hopped over and forced apart the bushes, in which there did not seem to be an opening. When Winston followed her, he found that they were in a natural clearing, a tiny grassy knoll surrounded by tall saplings that shut it in completely. The girl stopped and turned.

Era evidente que habÃ­a estado allÃ­ antes, pues sus movimientos eran los de una persona que tiene la costumbre de ir siempre por el mismo sitio. Winston la siguiÃ³ sin soltar su ramo de flores. Su primera sensaciÃ³n fue de alivio, pero mientras contemplaba el cuerpo femenino, esbelto y fuerte a la vez, que se movÃ­a ante Ã©l, y se fijaba en el ancho cinturÃ³n rojo, lo bastante apretado para hacer resaltar la curva de sus caderas, empezÃ³ a sentir su propia inferioridad. Incluso ahora le parecÃ­a muy probable que cuando ella se volviera y lo mirara, lo abandonarÃ­a. La dulzura del aire y el verdor de las hojas lo hechizaban. Ya cuando venÃ­a de la estaciÃ³n, el sol de mayo le habÃ­a hecho sentirse sucio y gastado, una criatura de puertas adentro que llevaba pegado a la piel el polvo de Londres. Se le ocurriÃ³ pensar que hasta ahora no lo habÃ­a visto ella de cara a plena luz. Llegaron al Ã¡rbol derribado del que la joven habÃ­a hablado. Winston, al seguirla, vio que el pequeÃ±o espacio estaba rodeado todo por arbustos y oculto por ellos. La muchacha se detuvo y, volviÃ©ndose hacia Ã©l, le dijo:

st: O ile a sheba holimo. E ne e le ngoanana eo. O ile a sisinya hlooho ea hae, ho bonahala e le temoso ea hore o tlameha ho khutsa, ebe o arola lihlahla 'me ka potlako o ile a etella pele tseleng e moqotetsane ka lehong. Ho hlakile hore o ne a le ka tsela eo, hobane o ile a etsa hore ho be le li-buds joalokaha eka ke tloaelo. Ka mor'a moo, Steve o ile a tsoela pele ho etsa hore lipalesa tsa hae li se ke tsa e-ba teng. Maikutlo a hae a pele e ne e le phomolo, empa ha a ntse a shebella 'mele o matla o mosesane o tsamaea ka pel'a hae, ka sash e sekareleta e neng e le thata ho lekana ho ntÅ¡a mothinya oa letheka la hae, kutloisiso ea ho ba tlase ha hae e ne e le boima ho eena. Le ha ho le jwalo, ho ne ho bonahala eka ha a ne a le haufi le yena mme a mo sheba hore o tla kgutlela morao. Monko o monate oa moea le botala ba makhasi a mo khahla. Ha a ntse a tsamaea ho tloha seteisheneng, letsatsi la Mots'eanong letsatsi o ne a entse hore a ikutloe a le litÅ¡ila 'me a hlaphohuoa, sebopuoa sa ka tlung, ka lerÅle la sooty la London ka pores ea letlalo la hae. O ne a e-s'o bone hore ha ho mohla a kileng a kopana le eena letsatsing le pharaletseng. Ba fihla sefateng se oeleng seo a neng a buile ka sona. Ngoanana o ile a kenella mme a qobelloa ho arola lihlahla, moo ho neng ho bonahala ho se na ho bula. Ha Winston a mo latela, o ile a fumana hore ba sebakeng sa tlhaho se hlakileng, knoll e nyane ea joang e pota-potiloe ke li-saplings tse bolelele tse e koalang ka botlalo. 'Me mosali o ile a ema' me a reteleha.

tn: O ne a lebelela godimo. Ya ne le girl. O ne a tshikinya tlhogo ya gagwe, go bonala e le tlhagiso ya gore o tshwanetse go didimala, morago a kgaoganya metsu mme ka bonako a isa tsela mo tseleng e e pitlaganeng mo sekgweng. O ne a setse a tlwaetse go dira jalo, ka gonne o ne a ntse a dira jaaka e kete o ne a tlwaetse go dira jalo. Ka tsela e e sa ntseng e tsamaya, O ne a sa ntse a kgabisa di-flowers tsa gagwe. Maikutlo a gagwe a ntlha e ne e le go imola, fela fa a bona mmele o o nonofileng o o tsamayang fa pele ga gagwe, o na le sasaka se se bohibidu jo bo neng bo le thata mo go ene, go ne go le thata go ntsha mo lethekeng la gagwe, tlhaloganyo ya gagwe e e kwa tlase e ne e le bokete mo go ene. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go lebega e kete fa a ne a le gaufi le ene, o ne a mo lebile a bo a mo lebile. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go le thata go bona gore go na le mmala le botala jwa lefaufau jo bo neng bo mo gopotsa. Fa a ne a le mo tseleng, letsatsi la May le ne le mo dira gore a ikutlwe a le maswe e bile a le maswe, sebopiwa sa ka fa gare, se se nang le lorole lwa lobone lwa Lontone mo di-pores tsa letlalo la gagwe. O ne a re ga a ise a ke a mmone a le mo letsatsing le le tseneletseng. Ba fitlha kwa setlhareng se se omeletseng se a neng a se bua. Mosetsana o ne a fuduega mme a ikgatholosa ka fa tlase ga ditsuonyana, fa go ne go lebega go se na sepe se se neng se sa butswe. Fa Winston a mo latela, o ne a bona gore ba ne ba le mo go utlwalang sentle, go ne go na le selo se sennye sa bojang se se neng se dikologilwe ke di-sapling tse di telele tse di neng di e tswalela ka botlalo. Mosadi a ema a ba a retologa.

mg: Nitraka izy. Zazavavy ilay izy. Nanozongozona ny lohany izy, izay azo antoka fa fampitandremana fa tsy maintsy mangina izy, avy eo dia nizara ireo kirihitra ary nitarika haingana ny lalana nanaraka ilay lalana tery ho any anaty ala. Mazava ho azy fa efa toy izany izy teo aloha, satria nanala ireo sombin-kazo toy ny hoe tamin'ny alalan'ny fahazarana izy. Nanaraka izany i Winston, mbola nitehaka ny voninkazony maromaro. Ny fahatsapana voalohany nataony dia ny fahamaivanana, saingy rehefa nijery ilay vatana matanjaka manify nihetsika teo anoloany izy, niaraka tamin'ilay saron-tava mena izay somary tery loatra ka nahatonga ny valahany hivoaka ny valahany, dia mavesatra taminy ny fahatsapana ny fahakelezany. Na dia amin'izao fotoana izao aza dia toa azo inoana fa rehefa nitodika izy ary nijery azy dia niverina tamin'ny laoniny mihitsy. Ny hatsaran'ny rivotra sy ny zava-maitso amin'ny ravina dia nampihorohoro azy. Efa teo am-pandehanana avy tao amin'ny gara, ny masoandro tamin'ny volana Mey dia nahatonga azy hahatsapa ho maloto sy nitokana, zavaboary ao an-trano, miaraka amin'ny vovoka mivaingana ao Londona ao amin'ny pores of his skin. Tonga saina izy fa hatramin'izao dia mety mbola tsy nahita azy tamin'ny andro mazava be teny an-kalamanjana izy. Dia nankeo amin'ny hazo izay efa nolazainy izy ireo. Nitsaitsaika ilay zazavavy ary nanery ireo kirihitra, izay toa tsy nisy fisokafana. Rehefa nanaraka azy i Winston dia hitany fa tao anatin'ny fanadiovana voajanahary izy ireo, knoll kely feno bozaka voahodidin'ny zana-kazo lava izay nanakatona tanteraka azy. Nijanona ilay zazavavy ary nihodina.

en: They were standing in the shade of hazel bushes. The sunlight, filtering through innumerable leaves, was still hot on their faces. Winston looked out into the field beyond, and underwent a curious, slow shock of recognition. He knew it by sight. An old, close-bitten pasture, with a footpath wandering across it and a molehill here and there. In the ragged hedge on the opposite side the boughs of the elm trees swayed just perceptibly in the breeze, and their leaves stirred faintly in dense masses like womenâ€™s hair. Surely somewhere nearby, but out of sight, there must be a stream with green pools where dace were swimming.

tn: Ba ne ba eme mo moriting wa ga Hazel Bushes. Letsatsi le le neng le tsamaya ka lone, le ne le sa ntse le le mogote mo difatlhegong tsa bone. O ne a leba kwa tshimong e e kwa tlase, mme a nna le letshogo le le bonya la go nna le letshogo le le bonya. Oaitse Sebone Go na le mafulo a bogologolo, a a nang le tselana e e tsamayang ka yone le tsela e e kgabaganyang mo go yone le mopogela fa le kwa teng. Mo godimo ga moo, go ne go na le ditlhare tse di neng di le mo godimo ga ditlhare tsa elm di ne tsa fudusa fela mo boriting, mme matlhare a bone a ne a fuduega mo makgwafong a a thata jaaka moriri wa basadi. Tota e bile, kwa ntle ga go bona, go tshwanetse ga bo go na le metsi a a nang le metsi a a kwa godimo.

en: â€œYou will have heard rumors of the existence of the Brotherhood. No doubt you have formed your own picture of it. You have imagined, probably, a huge underworld of conspirators, meeting secretly in cellars, scribbling messages on walls, recognizing one another by code words or by special movements of the hand. Nothing of the kind exists. The members of the Brotherhood have no way of recognizing one another, and it is impossible for any one member to be aware of the identity of more than a very few others. Goldstein himself, if he fell into the hands of the Thought Police, could not give them a complete list of members, or any information that would lead them to a complete list. No such list exists. The Brotherhood cannot be wiped out because it is not an organization in the ordinary sense. Nothing holds it together except an idea which is indestructible. You will never have anything to sustain you except the idea. You will get no comradeship and no encouragement. When finally you are caught, you will get no help. We never help our members. At most, when it is absolutely necessary that someone should be silenced, we are occasionally able to smuggle a razor blade into a prisonerâ€™s cell. You will have to get used to living without results and without hope. You will work for a while, you will be caught, you will confess, and then you will die. Those are the only results that you will ever see. There is no possibility that any perceptible change will happen within our own lifetime. We are the dead. Our only true life is in the future. We shall take part in it as handfuls of dust and splinters of bone. But how far away that future may be, there is no knowing. It might be a thousand years. At present nothing is possible except to extend the area of sanity little by little. We cannot act collectively. We can only spread our knowledge outwards from individual to individual, generation after generation. In the face of the Thought Police there is no other way.â€

El propio Goldstein, si cayera en manos de la PolicÃ­a del Pensamiento, no podrÃ­a dar una lista completa de los afiliados ni informaciÃ³n alguna que les sirviera para hacer el servicio. En realidad, no hay tal lista. La Hermandad no puede ser barrida porque no es una organizaciÃ³n en el sentido corriente de la palabra. Nada mantiene su cohesiÃ³n a no ser la idea de que es indestructible. No tendrÃ©is nada en que apoyaros aparte de esa idea. No encontrarÃ©is camaraderÃ­a ni estÃ­mulo. Cuando finalmente seÃ¡is detenidos por la PolicÃ­a, nadie os ayudarÃ¡. Nunca ayudamos a nuestros afiliados. Todo lo mÃ¡s, cuando es absolutamente necesario que alguien calle, introducimos clandestinamente una hoja de afeitar en la celda del compaÃ±ero detenido. Es la Ãºnica ayuda que a veces prestamos. DebÃ©is acostumbraros a la idea de vivir sin esperanza. TrabajarÃ©is algÃºn tiempo, os detendrÃ¡n, confesarÃ©is y luego os matarÃ¡n. Esos serÃ¡n los Ãºnicos resultados que podrÃ©is ver. No hay posibilidad de que se produzca ningÃºn cambio perceptible durante vuestras vidas. Nosotros somos los muertos. Nuestra Ãºnica vida verdadera estÃ¡ en el futuro. Tomaremos parte en Ã©l como puÃ±ados de polvo y astillas de hueso. Pero no se sabe si este futuro estÃ¡ mÃ¡s o menos lejos. QuizÃ¡ tarde mil aÃ±os. Por ahora lo Ãºnico posible es ir extendiendo el Ã¡rea de la cordura poco a poco. No podemos actuar colectivamente. SÃ³lo podemos difundir nuestro conocimiento de individuo en individuo, de generaciÃ³n en generaciÃ³n. Ante la PolicÃ­a del Pensamiento no hay otro medio.

st: "U tla be u utloile ka ho ba teng ha mokhatlo oa bara ba motho. Ha ho pelaelo hore u entse setÅ¡oantÅ¡o sa hau. U nahanne, mohlomong, lefats'e le leholo la ba fetohelang, ho kopana ka lekunutu ka cellars, melaetsa e hlahisang marako, ho lemoha e mong ka mantsoe a khoutu kapa ka metsamao e khethehileng ea letsoho. Ha ho letho la mofuta ona. Litho tsa Mokhatlo oa Bara ba Motho ha li na mokhoa oa ho lemohana, 'me ho ke ke ha khoneha hore setho leha e le sefe se tsebe boitsebiso ba batho ba fetang ba bang ba seng bakae. Goldstein ka boeena, haeba a oela matsohong a Sepolesa sa Thought, a ke ke a ba fa lenane le felletseng la litho, kapa tlhaiso-leseling efe kapa efe e neng e tla ba lebisa lenaneng le felletseng. Ha ho lenane le joalo. Mokhatlo oa bara ba motho o ke ke oa felisoa hobane ha se mokhatlo ka kutloisiso e tloaelehileng. Ha ho na letho le e nkang hammoho ntle le mohopolo o sa bonahaleng. Ha ho mohla u tla ba le letho le ka u tÅ¡ehetsang ntle le mohopolo. U ke ke ua ba le metsoalle kapa khothatso. Qetellong, haeba u tÅ¡oeroe, u ke ke ua fumana thuso. Ha ho mohla re tla thusa litho tsa rona. Ka linako tse ling, ha ho hlokahala hore motho e mong a khutse, ka linako tse ling re khona ho hula lehare ka seleng ea motÅ¡oaruoa. U tla tlameha ho tloaela ho phela ntle le litholoana ntle le tÅ¡epo. U tla sebetsa ka nakoana, u tla tÅ¡oaroa, u tla ipolela, 'me u tla shoa. Tsena ke tsona feela liphello tseo u tla li bona. Ha ho na monyetla oa hore phetoho efe kapa efe e sa amoheleheng e tla etsahala bophelong ba rona. Re bafu. Bophelo ba rona feela ba 'nete bo teng nakong e tlang. Re tla nka karolo ho eona e le lerÅle le nang le li-splinters tsa masapo. Empa bokamoso bo hole hakae boo bo ka bang teng, ha ho na tsebo. E ka 'na ea e-ba lilemo tse sekete. Hajoale ha ho letho le khonehang ntle le ho lelefatsa sebaka sa bohlanya hanyane ka hanyane. Re ke ke ra sebetsa ka bonngoe. Re ka phatlalatsa feela tsebo ea rona ka ntle ho motho ka mong, moloko ka mor'a moloko. Ha re tobane le mapolesa a nahanang ha ho na tsela e 'ngoe. "

tn: 'O ne wa utlwa medumo ya go nna teng ga bokaulengwe' - You will have heard the rumor of the existence of the brotherhood Ga go pelaelo gore o setse o na le setshwantshÃ´ sa gago mo go sone. O ne wa akanya gore, go ka direga gore go nne le batho ba ba ratang go nna le batho ba ba sa itseng, ba ba neng ba le mo metlheng e e kwa tlase, ba ne ba bua ka mafoko a a sa tlwaelegang kgotsa ka go dirisa mafoko a a kgethegileng. Ga go na sepe sa mofuta ope o o ntseng jalo. Maloko a Mokgatlho wa Mokgatlho wa Modimo ga a na mokgwa wa go lemogana, mme ga go kgonege gore leloko lengwe le lengwe le itsewe ka boitshupo jwa batho ba ba fetang ba bangwe ba le mmalwa fela. O ne a ka se kgone go dira jalo, fa a ne a ka se kgone go ba naya lenaane le le feletseng la maloko, kgotsa tshedimosetso nngwe le nngwe e e tla ba lebisang kwa lenaaneng le le feletseng. Ga go na lenaane le le ntseng jalo. Mokgatlho o o ka se keng wa nyelediwa ka ntlha ya gore ga se mokgatlho o o tlwaelegileng o o tlwaelegileng. Le fa go ntse jalo, ga go na sepe se se dirang gore go nne le kakanyo e e sa itumediseng. Ga o kitla o nna le sengwe se o ka se go thusang fa e se mogopolo wa gago. Ga o kitla o nna le ditsala tsa gago mme o se ka wa nna le seabe sepe. Kwa bokhutlong, ga o kitla o bona thuso. Ga re thuse maloko a rona. Le fa go ntse jalo, fa go tlhokega gore motho a didimale, ka dinako tse dingwe re ka kgona go tsenya legare mo seleng ya kgolegelo. O tla tshwanelwa ke go tshela kwa ntle ga dipoelo mme o se na tsholofelo. O tla dira tiro ka lobakanyana, o tla tshwarwa; o tla ipolela, mme morago ga foo o tla swa. Tseo ke tsone fela tse o ka di bonang. Le fa go ntse jalo, ga go kitla go nna le phetogo epe fela e e tla diragalang mo botshelong jwa rona. Re ne re le batho ba ba suleng. E ne e le tshelo fela ya boammaaruri mo nakong e e tlang. Re tla nna le seabe mo go lone jaaka lerole le le nang le lentsi le lennye le le nang le marapo. Le fa go ntse jalo, isagwe e bokgakala jo bo kana kang, ga go na kitso e e kana kang. ^ Kgotsa "dingwaga tse di sekete." Ga go na sepe se se ka kgonagalang fa e se go katolosa lefatshe le lennye fela. Ga re ka ke ra kgona go dira dilo mmogo. Re ka dira fela gore re nne le kitso ya rona go tswa mo bathong ka bongwe go ya ka batho, go ya go kokomana morago ga kokomana. 'Mapodise a ne a se na tsela e sele' - The police is no other ways

mg: Handre tsaho momba ny fisian'ny Mpirahalahy ianao. Azo antoka fa namorona ny sarinao manokana ianao. Azonao an-tsaina, angamba, ny tontolon'ny tsikombakomba goavana, ny fihaonana miafina ao amin'ny lakaly, ny fifandraisana amin'ny rindrina, ny fahafantarana ny tsirairay amin'ny alalan'ny teny kaody na amin'ny alalan'ny hetsika manokana ataon'ny tanana. Tsy misy na inona na inona amin'ny karazany. Tsy manana fomba hifankahafantatra ireo mpikambana ao amin'ny Firahalahiana, ary tsy ho vitan'ny mpikambana iray ny mahafantatra ny mombamomba ny olona mihoatra ny vitsy hafa. Goldstein izy tenany, raha lavo teo an-tÃ nan'ny Polisy Eritreritra, dia tsy afaka nanome azy ireo lisitra feno mpikambana, na fampahalalana izay hitarika azy ireo ho amin'ny lisitra feno. Tsy misy izany lisitra izany. Tsy azo foanana ny Firahalahiana satria tsy fikambanana amin'ny heviny mahazatra. Tsy misy na inona na inona mihazona izany afa-tsy hevitra izay tsy azo ravana. Tsy hanana na inona na inona hanohanana anao ianao afa-tsy ilay hevitra. Tsy hahazo namana ianao ary tsy hisy fankaherezana. Rehefa tratra ianao amin'ny farany, dia tsy hahazo fanampiana. Tsy manampy ny mpikambana mihitsy izahay. Amin'ny ankapobeny, rehefa tena ilaina ny mampangina olona iray, dia indraindray isika afaka mampiditra hareza an-tsokosoko ao amin'ny efitry ny gadra. Tsy maintsy zatra miaina tsy misy valiny ianao ary tsy misy fanantenana. Hiasa mandritra ny fotoana fohy ianao, ho tratra ianao, hibaboka ary ho faty amin'izay. Ireo no hany vokatra ho hitanao hatramin'izay. Tsy misy fiovana azo tsapain-tanana hitranga eo amin'ny fiainantsika. Maty izahay. Ny fiainana tena izy dia amin'ny ho avy. Ary [tsy nandeha] teny amin'ireo [mpangataka] izay mifindrafindra mitety fiara izahay. Saingy hatraiza no mety ho lavitra izany hoavy izany, tsy misy fahalalana. Mety ho arivo taona izany. Amin'izao fotoana izao dia tsy misy zavatra azo atao afa-tsy ny manitatra tsikelikely ny faritra ara-pahasalamana. Tsy afaka miara-miasa isika. Tsy afaka manaparitaka afa-tsy ny fahalalantsika ivelany isika, miainga amin'ny isam-batan'olona ka hatrany amin'ny taranaka tsirairay, taranaka mifandimby. Tsy misy fomba hafa ankoatra izany eo anatrehan'ny polisy."

en: By the third day his eyes ached unbearably and his spectacles needed wiping every few minutes. It was like struggling with some crushing physical task, something which one had the right to refuse and which one was nevertheless neurotically anxious to accomplish. In so far as he had time to remember it, he was not troubled by the fact that every word he murmured into the speakwrite, every stroke of his ink pencil, was a deliberate lie. He was as anxious as anyone else in the Department that the forgery should be perfect. On the morning of the sixth day the dribble of cylinders slowed down. For as much as half an hour nothing came out of the tube; then one more cylinder, then nothing. Everywhere at about the same time the work was easing off. A deep and as it were secret sigh went through the Department. A mighty deed, which could never be mentioned, had been achieved. It was now impossible for any human being to prove by documentary evidence that the war with Eurasia had ever happened. At twelve hundred it was unexpectedly announced that all workers in the Ministry were free till tomorrow morning. Winston, still carrying the brief case containing the book, which had remained between his feet while he worked and under his body while he slept, went home, shaved himself, and almost fell asleep in his bath, although the water was barely more than tepid.

Por todas partes ocurrÃ­a igual. Un hondo y secreto suspiro recorriÃ³ el Ministerio. Se acababa de realizar una hazaÃ±a que nadie podrÃ­a mencionar nunca. Era imposible ya que ningÃºn ser humano pudiera probar documentalmente que la guerra con Eurasia habÃ­a sucedido. Inesperadamente, se anunciÃ³ que todos los trabajadores del Ministerio estaban libres hasta el dÃ­a siguiente por la maÃ±ana. Era mediodÃ­a. Winston, que llevaba todavÃ­a la cartera con el libro, la cual habÃ­a permanecido entre sus pies mientras trabajaba y debajo de su cuerpo mientras dormÃ­a, se fue a casa, se afeitÃ³ y casi se quedÃ³ dormido en el baÃ±o, aunque el agua estaba casi frÃ­a.

st: Ka letsatsi la boraro, mahlo a hae a ne a sa ts'oarehe 'me li-spectacles tsa hae li ne li hloka ho hlakola metsotso e meng le e meng e seng mekae. Ho ne ho tÅ¡oana le ho loana le mosebetsi o sithabetsang oa 'mele, e leng ntho e neng e na le tokelo ea ho hana le eo motho a neng a e-na le maikutlo a ho e etsa. Ho fihlela ha a ne a e-na le nako ea ho e hopola, ha aa ka a khathatsoa ke taba ea hore lentsoe le leng le le leng leo a neng a korotlela ka lona, le leng le le leng la pentÅ¡ele ea hae ea enke, e ne e le leshano ka boomo. O ne a tshwenyehile jwalo ka mang kapa mang Lefapheng hore mofolisi o lokela ho ba a phethahetseng. Hoseng ha letsatsi la botÅ¡elela, li-cylinders tsa li-cylinders li ile tsa theoha. Hoo e ka bang halofo ea hora ha ho letho le tsoang ho tube; Ka mor'a moo, silindara se seng hape, ha ho letho le leng. Ka nako e ts'oanang, mosebetsi o ne o le teng ka nako e le 'ngoe. E ne e le ho teba mme ha e ne e le sephiri sa ho feheloa ka har'a lefapha. Ketso e matla, e neng e ke ke ea boleloa, e ne e finyelloa. Hona joale ho ne ho ke ke ha khoneha hore motho leha e le ofe ho paka ka bopaki ba documentary hore ntoa le Eurasia e kile ea etsahala. Ho ile ha phatlalatsoa ba makholo a mabeli ho sa lebelloang hore basebetsi bohle ba tÅ¡ebeletsong ba lokolloe ho fihlela hoseng hosasane. Winston, o ntse a jere nyeoe e khuts'oane e nang le buka, e neng e lula lipakeng tsa maoto a hae ha a ntse a sebetsa le tlas'a 'mele oa hae ha a ntse a robetse, a ea hae, a itoola, mme a batla a robetse ka bate ea hae, leha metsi a ne a le tlase haholo ho feta tepid.

tn: Mo letsatsing la boraro, o ne a le mo tseleng e a neng a sa e lebelela, mme o ne a tlhoka go bona metsotso mengwe le mengwe e e seng kana ka sepe. Go ne go tshwana le go lwa le tiro e e rileng e e sa siamang, e e neng e na le tshwanelo ya go gana mme e le yone e e neng e tshwenyegile thata. Fa a ne a na le nako ya go e gopola, o ne a sa tshwenngwe ke gore lefoko lengwe le lengwe le lengwe le a neng a ngongorega ka lone, le lengwe le lengwe la senkepeng sa gagwe e ne e le maaka. O ne a itshwenya jaaka mongwe le mongwe mo Lefapheng gore go tshwanetse ga nna le diphoso. Mo mosong wa borataro, mo mosong wa borataro, go ne ga nna le di-cylinders tse di neng di le kwa tlase. 10A ga go a ka ga nna le sepe se se tswang kwa ntle ga mosedi; 12 - Mme LÃ©a, Mme LÃ©a. Ka nako e le nngwe, tiro e ne ya fela. E ne e le e e tseneletseng mme fa e ne e le sephiri se se neng sa feta mo bodireding. Tiro e e nonofileng e e neng e sa ka ke ya umakiwa, e ne ya diragadiwa. Go ne go sa kgonege gore batho botlhe ba ba nang le bosupi jwa gore ntwa eno e ne e ise e diragale. Go ne go sa lebelelwa gore botlhe ba ba neng ba le mo bodireding ba ne ba gololwa go fitlha ka moso. Winston, a sa ntse a tshwere kgang e khutshwane e e nang le buka, e e neng e setse e le fa gare ga dinao tsa gagwe fa a ntse a dira le fa tlase ga mmele wa gagwe fa a ntse a robetse, a ya kwa gae, a itobosile, mme a batla a robetse mo tlhapelong ya gagwe, le fa metsi a ne a le mo tlase ga tepid.

ty: I te toru o te mahana, ua araara to ' na mata e ua tia ia ' na ia tamÇrÃ» i te mau minuti atoa. Mai te huru ra e, te aro ra vau i te tahi ohipa teimaha i te pae tino, te hoÃª mea e ti'a i te hoÃª taata ia pato'i e o ta te hoÃª taata e hinaaro e rave. No te mea e taime to ' na no te haamana'o i te reira, aita oia i haapeapea i te mea e ua riro te mau parau atoa o ta ' na i amuamu i roto i te penitara, te mauraa atoa o ta ' na peni inita, ei haavare opuahia. E mana'ona'oraa rahi to'na mai to te tahi atu mau taata i roto i te tuhaa faatere, ia riro te reira ei mea maitai roa. I te poipoi o te ono o te mahana, ua taere te taheraa o te mau cylinders. No te maororaa hoÃª afa hora aita hoÃª a'e mea i matara mai mai roto mai i te afata; i muri iho, te tahi faahou Ã¯a pereoo, e aita hoÃª a'e mea. I te mau vahi atoa, i te hoÃª Ã¢ taime, ua mÇrÃ» mai te ohipa. Ua puta mai te hoÃª mana'o hohonu e te huna i roto i te piha toro'a. Ua ravehia te hoÃª ohipa puai, o te ore roa e nehenehe e faahitihia. I teie nei, eita ta te hoÃª taata e nehenehe e haapapu na roto i te mau parau haapapuraa e aita roa ' tu te tama'i e o Eurasia i tupu a'enei. I te ahuru ma piti hanere, ua faaitehia ma te mana'o - ore - hia e mea tamoni ore te mau rave ohipa atoa i roto i te Taviniraa e tae roa ' tu i te poipoi a'e. Te amo noa ra oia i te tupuraa poto e vai ra i roto i te buka, o tei vai noa i ropu i to ' na avae a rave noa ' i oia i te ohipa e i raro a'e i to ' na tino a taoto noa ' i oia, ua ho'i oia i te fare, ua hahu ia ' na iho, e ua fatata roa oia i te taoto i roto i to ' na vahi hopuraa pape, noa ' tu e e ere te pape i te mea puai roa.

mg: Tamin'ny andro fahatelo dia tsy zaka ny masony ary nila famafÃ na isaky ny minitra vitsy ny masony. Toy ny hoe miady mafy amin'ny asa ara-batana mahatsiravina izany, zavatra izay manan-jo handÃ  ary izay olona iray na izany aza dia maniry mafy ny hanatanteraka izany. Raha ny momba ny fotoana nananany fotoana hahatsiarovana izany, dia tsy nanahy izy noho ny hoe lainga iniana ny teny rehetra nimonomononany tao anatin'ny fanoratana ny teny, ny tsindrim-peo rehetra tamin'ny pensiliny ranomainty. Nitebiteby toy ny olon-drehetra tao amin'ny Departemanta izy fa tokony ho tonga lafatra ilay hosoka. Ny marainan'ny andro fahenina dia nihena ny fihenan'ny cylinders. Nandritra ny antsasak'adiny dia tsy nisy na inona na inona nivoaka avy tao amin'ilay fantsona; Avy eo dia misy cylinder iray hafa, avy eo tsy misy na inona na inona. Na aiza na aiza tamin'izany fotoana izany dia nihena ny asa. Nisy fahanginana lalina sy miafina nandalo tao amin'ny Departemanta. Nisy asa mahery vaika, izay tsy hay lazaina mihitsy. Tsy ho vitan'ny olombelona intsony ny hanaporofo amin'ny alalan'ny porofo fanadihadiana fa efa nisy ny ady tamin'i Eorazia. Tamin'ny 12 ora dia nambara tampoka fa afaka ny mpiasa rehetra ao amin'ny minisitera mandra-pahatongan'ny ampitso maraina. Winston, izay mbola nitondra ilay tranga fohy izay nahitana ilay boky, izay nijanona teo anelanelan'ny tongony fony izy niasa sy teo ambanin'ny vatany raha mbola natory izy, dia nandeha nody, nanala ny tenany, ary saika natory tao amin'ny fandroana, na dia zara raha nihoatra ny tepid aza ny rano.

tn: "Ee, ke ne ke na le molato!" ga lela Mma Ramotswe ka mogala fa godimo ga leselo le le kwa godimo. 'A ga o a tshwanela go tshwara monna yo o se nang molato, a ga go jalo?' Le fa go ntse jalo, sefatlhego sa gagwe se ne sa nna se ritibetse, tota le gone se ne sa dira gore go nne le bokao jo bo sa reroang. "Ke selo se se tshosang, monnamogolo," a bua jalo ka kutlobotlhoko. mme insse. O ka kgona go itshoka le fa o sa itse. A o gakologelwa gore di ile tsa ntshwara jang? mo borokong jwa me! Ya, that's a fact. Ke ne ke dira tiro ya me e e sa siamang, ke ne ke sa itse gore ke na le dilo tse di bosula mo mogopolong wa me. Mme ka nako eo ke ne ke bua le nna ke robetse. A o a itse gore ke eng se ke se utlwileng se re se buang?

en: The door opened, and another prisoner was brought in whose appearance sent a momentary chill through Winston. He was a commonplace, mean-looking man who might have been an engineer or technician of some kind. But what was startling was the emaciation of his face. It was like a skull. Because of its thinness the mouth and eyes looked disproportionately large, and the eyes seemed filled with a murderous, unappeasable hatred of somebody or something.

en: Perhaps the needle was at eightyâ€”ninety. Winston could only intermittently remember why the pain was happening. Behind his screwed-up eyelids a forest of fingers seemed to be moving in a sort of dance, weaving in and out, disappearing behind one another and reappearing again. He was trying to count them, he could not remember why. He knew only that it was impossible to count them, and that this was somehow due to the mysterious identity between five and four. The pain died down again. When he opened his eyes it was to find that he was still seeing the same thing. Innumerable fingers, like moving trees, were still streaming past in either direction, crossing and recrossing. He shut his eyes again.

en: At this moment there was a devastating explosion, or what seemed like an explosion, though it was not certain whether there was any noise. There was undoubtedly a blinding flash of light. Winston was not hurt, only prostrated. Although he had already been lying on his back when the thing happened, he had a curious feeling that he had been knocked into that position. A terrific, painless blow had flattened him out. Also something had happened inside his head. As his eyes regained their focus he remembered who he was, and where he was, and recognized the face that was gazing into his own; but somewhere or other there was a large patch of emptiness, as though a piece had been taken out of his brain.

st: Motsotsong ona ho bile le ho phatloha ho senyang, kapa ho ne ho bonahala eka ke ho phatloha, leha ho ne ho se na bonnete ba hore na ho na le lerata. Ntle ho pelaelo, ho ne ho e-na le leseli le khanyang. Winston ha aa ka a utloisoa bohloko, empa e ne e le prostst. Le hoja a ne a se a ntse a bua leshano mokokotlong oa hae ha ntho eo e etsahala, o ne a e-na le maikutlo a bohelehele ba hore o ne a kokotiloe boemong boo. Ho ne ho e-na le ntho e makatsang le e bohloko e neng e mo soeufetse. Ho nale se etsahetseng ka hare ho hlooho ya hae. Ha mahlo a hae a boela a tsepamisa maikutlo a bona, a hopola hore na ke mang, le hore na o hokae, mme a lemoha sefahleho se shebileng hae; Empa kae kapa kae moo ho neng ho e-na le sekhechana se seholo sa lefeela, joalo ka ha eka sekhechana se ne se tlositsoe bokong ba hae.

tn: Mo nakong eno, go ne go na le go thubega ga go na sepe se se utlwisang botlhoko, kgotsa se se neng se lebega jaaka go thubega, le fa go ne go sa tlhomamisege gore a go ne go na le modumo ope. Go ne go sa pelaelo gore go ne go na le lesedi le le phatsimang. Ga go a ka ga nna le sepe se se utlwisang botlhoko, mme o ne a se ka a isiwa kwa go ene fela. Le fa a ne a sa ntse a le kwa morago fa selo se se neng se direga, o ne a na le maikutlo a a utlwalang a gore o ne a le mo seemong seo.
